item.title: Overwatch 2026 Roadmap—All Overwatch 2026 Content, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Overwatch has kick-started a new era for the hero-shooter by dropping the “2” and launching a new year-long Reign of Talon story arc. Gone are the days of Season-long narratives, as Blizzard has grander plans for the plot of Overwatch.

From now on, every year will be split into six Seasons, as a year-long narrative unfolds. This starts with Season 1 (2026) of Overwatch, and a new story arc will begin with Season 1 in 2027.

The Reign of Talon is the first story, so it’s time to unpack what Overwatch has planned for the year 2026.

Overwatch Season 1 2026 Roadmap Content, Explained

Season 1 of Overwatch is when the Reign of Talon story arc begins, and Blizzard is kicking it off with a bang. A wealth of new content is arriving in Overwatch, including the likes of five new Heroes launching all at once! The full list of content for Season 1 includes:

  • 5 New Heroes
  • Conquest Event
  • Hero Sub-Passives Feature
  • New Stadium Hero: Vendetta
  • New Stadium Feature: Hero Builder
  • New Mythics
  • Overwatch X Hello Kitty And Friends Collab

Overwatch Season 2 2026 Roadmap Content, Explained

Details regarding the following Seasons of Overwatch get thinner and thinner the further 2026 progresses, but Season 2 still has a fair bit of information. The number of new Heroes drops to one per Season, but there’s an Anniversary event that could be exciting.

Judging by the Roadmap, Season 2 can be expected to begin in the middle of Spring 2026. Here’s all of the confirmed content so far:

  • New Hero
  • Overwatch 10 Year Anniversary
  • Post Match Accolades
  • New Stadium Hero: Ramattra
  • New Mythics
  • OWCS Champions Clash
  • + More

Overwatch Season 3 2026 Roadmap Content, Explained

Season 3’s highlight is easily the confirmation of a new map, though another Hero is also to be expected. The Roadmap suggests that Season 3 should begin at the start of Summer, 2026, and here’s what content should be released:

  • New Hero
  • New Map: Japan Night
  • OWCS at eSports World Cup
  • New Mythics
  • + More

Overwatch Season 4 2026 Roadmap Content, Explained

Information pertaining to Season 4 of Overwatch is much drier than the others, but it can be expected to launch in the middle of Summer, 2026. Here’s what’s been confirmed so far:

  • New Hero
  • Blizzcon
  • Overwatch World Cup
  • + Much More

That wraps up the announced content for Overwatch in 2026, but there are still two more Seasons that remain unaccounted for. They’ll likely release in Fall 2026 and Winter 2026, leading directly into the new story arc in 2027.

item.title: Overwatch Season 1 (2026) Release Date Countdown & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
Overwatch has dropped the “2” as the live-service hero-shooter kickstarts a new era for the franchise. Season 1 is where it all begins, and it’s just around the corner.

It’s one of the biggest updates Overwatch has ever seen, with five new Heroes launching at once, as well as a host of other gameplay changes. Being an Overwatch fan hasn’t been this exciting in a very long time, and thankfully, you won’t have to wait too long to jump in.

Insider Gaming has the Overwatch Season 1 (2026) release date and exact times listed below.

What Is The Overwatch Season 1 (2026) Release Date?

Overwatch Season 1 (2026) will begin on February 5, 2026, though the date could change depending on where you live in the world.

Blizzard is using a global release structure for Overwatch Season 1, meaning all players from across the world can jump into the new Season at the same time. However, for some of you out there, that might mean waiting until February 11.

Overwatch Season 1 (2026) Start Times

Season 1 of Overwatch kicks off at 11 AM PT on February 10, with simultaneous launch times across various time zones.

All of the start times for Overwatch Season 1 across major regions are shown in the table below. If you’re not covered by one of these regions, be sure to adjust for your time zone.

item.title: Complete Nioh 3 Trophy List—How To Get All Achievements & Trophies & Difficulty Rating
item.content:encoded:
Like previous games in the series, you need to earn the Nioh 3 Platinum Trophy and get all the Achievements—it’s not just handed out. The lengthy list is a sumptuous slog, and you’ll need a lot of patience and precision to clear it up.

Nioh 3 is another in the long line of Soulslikes, which means it’s very hard. One false move is death in this game, and it’s the most compelling, cathartic, and crushing experience imaginable—but fun (mostly). If you’re not content with just completing Nioh 3, and you seek a further challenge, you should track down and obtain every Nioh 3 trophy and achievement.

All Nioh 3 Trophies & Achievements And How To Get

You need to level up Tokugawa Takechiyo, complete every region in its entirety, track down all collectibles, and do every quest and mission in Nioh 3 to earn every trophy and achievement.

It’s a lot of work, like we said, so here’s the list in its entirety:

  • You Are Nioh: Obtained all trophies.
  • Answering to the People: Completed all Myths.
  • Budding Talent: Reached level 10.
  • Grizzled Veteran: Reached level 100.
  • Wanderer in Time: Traveled through time for the first time.
  • Guiding Mirror: Received the Guiding Mirror from Li Naotora.
  • The Old Tiger Departs: Destroyed the Crucinite harbored within Takeda Shingen’s Guardian Spirit.
  • Unbreakable Cause: Destroyed the Crucinite harbored within Minamoto no Yoritomo’s Guardian Spirit.
  • The Queen’s Eyes Open: Destroyed the Crucinite harbored within Himiko’s Guardian Spirit.
  • What Must Be Done: Destroyed the Crucinite harbored within Tokugawa Yoshinobu’s Guardian Spirit.
  • Delusion Destroyed: Destroyed the Crucinite harbored within Haruko.
  • As Shogun: Was appointed the third shogun of the Edo Shogunate.
  • Crucible Arts Adopter: Learned a Martial Art from a Crucible weapon for the first time.
  • Arts Proficiency: Defeated 10 enemies with a Strong Attack or a Martial Art enhanced via Arts Proficiency.
  • Ninjutsu: Defeated 10 enemies with Ninjutsu.
  • Burst Break: Successfully activated Burst Break 10 times.
  • Guardian Spirit’s Aid: Successfully activated a Guardian Spirit Skill Burst Break for the first time.
  • Yokai Manipulator: Used a Summoning Seal to summon a yokai for the first time.
  • Devotee: Unlocked all named shrines and Bodhisattva Statues.
  • Explorer: Raised your Exploration Level to 4 in any area.
  • Masterful Pupil: Defeated a master for the first time.
  • A God Among Men: Defeated all masters.
  • Armor’s Real Value: Activated all set bonus effects for an equipment set.
  • Latest Masterpiece: Forged an item for the first time.
  • Match Made in Heaven: Performed a Soul Match for the first time.
  • Remodeler: Remodeled a piece of equipment for the first time.
  • Keen-Eyed: Pet a Chijiko for the first time.
  • Eagle-Eyed: Pet all Chijiko.
  • Unimpeded: Used all methods to traverse Spirit Veins.
  • Teamwork: Completed three missions during Expeditions or with NPCs (Includes Acolytes).
  • A Scampuss’s Best Friend: Traded a furball with a Scampuss in the Eternal Rift for the first time.
  • Spa Healer: Bathed in first hot spring.
  • Spa Lover: Bathed in every hot spring.
  • Kodama Leader: Guided all Kodama home.
  • Visiting the Six Jizo: Prayed at all of the Six Jizo.
  • Scampuss Enthusiast: Pet all Scampusses.
  • Soul Core Owner: Purified a Soul Core for the first time.
  • Base Captured: Captured an enemy base for the first time.
  • Total Control: Captured all enemy bases.
  • Lesser Crucible Cleanser: Purified a Lesser Crucible for the first time.
  • Lesser Crucible Eradicator: Purified all Lesser Crucibles.
  • Kunimatsu’s Pride: Defeated the Demon of Pride and glimpsed Kunimatsu’s emotions.
  • Kunimatsu’s Envy: Defeated the Demon of Envy and glimpsed Kunimatsu’s emotions.
  • Kunimatu’s Obsession: Defeated the Demon of Obsession and glimpsed Kunimatsu’s emotions.
  • Senji Toyo: Recovered the blacksmith’s memory.
  • Ruckus in the Sanctuary: In “Black Feather Sanctuary”, drove out all crows from Matsuo-taisha Shrine and defeated Otoroshi.
  • Pain, Pain, Go Away: In “A Sinister End”, repelled all of Murakumo’s attacks.
  • Distant Memories: Bathed with Himiko in “Dark Roots”, then recalled Naotora’s incident in “Apparition of Ryotan Temple”.
  • Like-Minded Friends: In “Seeking Rare Yokai”, satisfied Toriyama Sekien with a painting of Kusanagi.
  • Dung Ball Roller: Helped Tatsumaro the Dung Lover connect with Takechiyo.
  • Nothing Left to Learn: Completed veteran missions with Yagyu Muenori and Hattori Hanzo.

How Many Trophies & Achievements In Nioh 3?

You need to earn 51 Nioh 3 PlayStation Trophies if you want the Platinum Trophy.

There’s a nice distribution of Bronze, Silver, and Gold trophies, with plenty of Gamerscore to obtain. PlayStation users have the usual ‘one more trophy’ to earn, thanks to the PlayStation Platinum.

Are There Any Missable Trophies In Nioh 3?

Thanks to Insider Gaming’s playthrough of Nioh 3, getting the Platinum Trophy along the way, we can confirm there are no missable trophies, meaning you can get everything in one playthrough without worry.

Missable trophies and achievements are the bane of a hunter’s existence. Thankfully, we didn’t find any to be missable, so it can be one in one playthrough, if you have the time and skill!

Nioh 3 Platinum Difficulty Rating

For experienced Nioh players and Souls fans, the Platinum Difficulty Rating is a solid 7/10, but for newcomers and those of you who struggle more with Soulslikes, it has to go up to an 8 or a 9/10.

It’s an unforgiving game with a higher skill gap. Yes, you can level up and find better equipment, but it still might not be enough at times, and you might lose hours to the same boss. But it’s all doable, and the Platinum Trophy requires a completionist playthrough.

Good luck!

Let IG know how you get on with the game. If you get all the trophies and achievements, please share your achievement (see what we did there?) via the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.content:encoded:
Nioh 3’s move to an open-world structure means you’ll go globe-trotting and even time-traveling across different maps. The Warring States is a nice introductory setting, and it’s rife with collectibles and secrets.

The Nioh 3 Trophy List requires a lot of work, as does a completionist run of the game. Nioh 3 has missions, bosses, Kodama, Shrines, Hot Springs, Enemy Bases, and even more for you to find. The Warring States is a big location, and our two-fold map highlights every landmark and activity.

Full Warring States Map In Nioh 3—Northern Region

Unfortunately, the Warring States region is so big that it’s almost impossible to get everything in one image. This is why we’ve split the map into a North and South divide, and you can see the Nioh 3’s Warring States content from the top half.

There is something almost everywhere, and if you study the image long enough in your hunt to complete everything, you should be able to identify any missing spots on your own map.

If you reach Exploration Level 4 in a sub-region, it automatically reveals the remaining collectibles. Bear this in mind if you’re still struggling to find anything!

Full Warring States Map In Nioh 3—Southern Region

Insider Gaming promised you the second half of the Warring States map and all of its remaining collectibles, and here it is, and here they are.

item.title: Best Weapons To Use In Nioh 3—All Must-Have Samurai & Ninja Weapons
item.content:encoded:
Nioh 3 lets you effortlessly dual-wield Samurai and Ninja builds, and the Souls title has a huge arsenal of weapons. Some are objectively better than others, which is why this guide will help guide you.

There’s a lot of room to experiment with how to eliminate Yokai. You can opt for Low Stance barrages with lighter, faster weapons, or you might enjoy the thrill of doing massive damage with big Axes, for example. Nioh 3‘s weapon pool is healthy, but only a handful are top of the food chain.

Best Samurai Weapons In Nioh 3

The two best Samurai weapons you should focus on using in Nioh 3 are the Axe and Spear.

Axe

If you obtain an Axe, any other weapon rarely overpowers it from an Attack standpoint. It’s literally a giant Axe designed to carve and crucify opponents. You don’t even want to think about wasting Low Stance on it either; committing to an Axe build means staying in the middle ground, or ideally, unlocking and prioritizing High Stance to deal the most damage.

  • More IG: Nioh 3 Review: The Best Soulslike You Will Play In 2026

Not only is its default Attack power unmatched, but huge Axe attacks can break enemy guards and destroy stamina. The Lumber Chop Swift is a charging attack you can unlock. It consumes a hefty amount of Ki, but it can one-shot many mobs and deal huge damage to bosses.

Spear

Easily the greatest strength of Spears is their reach. If you’re not keen on parries and getting too close to enemies, you can poke and prod from a distance with the Spear. Big charging attacks are the perfect recipe to dip in, do a chunk of damage, and quickly duck out again.

Its versatility and slightly better mobility mean it’s also easier to reel off a mini-flurry of strikes—once again keeping a nice distance between you and your enemy, thanks to the extra frames. Twirl II is a great skill that increases your Attack and potency during a fight.

Best Ninja Weapons In Nioh 3

The Tonfa and Talons are comfortably the best options for the nimbleness of a Ninja in Nioh 3.

Talons

You could argue that the Talons and Tonfa are fairly interchangeable, but one of the biggest qualities of Talons is strong combos, which can absolutely decimate enemy Ki. This leaves them open to generous windows where you can inflict damage and make use of regular Grapple attacks to chop that HP bar down.

  • More IG: 7 Biggest Upcoming Soulslike Games In 2026

Many skills are effective for the Talon, but the Beyond Infinity unlock is the clear winner. If your timing is on point, you can link multiple attacks together, each as devastating as the last.

Tonfa

Again, the Tonfa is another dual-weapon capable of inflicting great HP and Ki damage. They scale with Strength, so if that’s a crucial stat for you to level up, a good Tonfa might be the ideal choice for you.

Dragon Slayer II is a hot pick for skills. You’re one good parry/deflect away from rebuttling with a big counterattacking move, increasing your Attack, and beginning another combo of strikes.

It’s all subjective at the end of the day. What works for IG might not work for you, and vice versa. So, this is where you’re encouraged to share your favorite weapons to use in Nioh 3 and what you think dominates the game easier. You can do this through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Starfield Will Launch in April 2026 on The PlayStation 5, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
A new report has claimed that long-awaited PlayStation 5 version of Starfield will be releasing in April 2026.

That’s according to a new report from PPE, which obtained internal documentation from a video game distributor revealing that Starfield is scheduled to launch on the PlayStation 5 on April 7, 2026.

While not confirmed in the report, it’s likely that the PlayStation 5 release will be a part of the long-awaited ‘Starfield 2.0’ update, which was shown to the press a few months ago.

It’s worth mentioning that PPE has had a good track record of leaking information related to physical game releases, however yesterday’s Take-Two Interactive call debunked their claims that GTA 6 would avoid physical game releases on launch.

That being said, PPE did provide a screenshot of what appears to be an internal system, showing that Starfield is going to release on April 7.

It isn’t quite clear what the update will bring, but according to rumours, Starfield’s massive update is set to deliver a major overhaul to the game, in addition to its second major expansion, ‘Terran Armada‘.

It’s currently unclear whether the rumoured Switch 2 version of the game will also release at the same time. XboxEra was the first to report on a planned Starfield version for the PlayStation 5 in February 2024.
